column5: Just wondering what kind of minnow this is..
it is either a emerald shinner or a shinner.
i think its shinner,  will have to find my baitfish book,and look it up,but i think thats what they are,i know walleyes like them for sure
....Definitely a shiner, likely the common shiner found in most creeks and rivers.
thanks for the help, my local creek has thousands of these and i just wanted to make sure what they were before i used them as bait...
I used to catch them in the creeks off of lake erie here I called them silver shiners, don`t know the proper name. Longer and thicker bodied than an emerald shiner, LOL good bait!
Is that a "Garden Hackle" fly you're usin' for bait???
It's a normal shinner, always catch a bunch of them in the creek near my house in the summer. If you ice fish then maybe you should freeze a couple for pike. They work very well.
xrap do you salt them or just straight out freeze them? thanks..
Definitely not an emerald shiner, but it is a shiner of some sort.
Nope just straight into a ziploc bag and then freeze them
If you add coarse salt before freezing then it won't get all mushy when you go to use it for Pike.
Looks like the type of minnow that catches fish.  Seriously, it looks like some sort of shiner as mentioned already.
Rob Hyatt.  Someone had to do it.
